meanings.definition: To come before in time or order.
meanings.sent1: The sun will preve the moon in the sky tonight.
meanings.sent2: I always preve my sister in line for the swings.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel preved the other animals by hiding extra nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition preved the outcome of the game before it even started.
meanings.sent5: The early bird preves the worm by waking up at dawn.

meanings.sent1: I preve the rain by bringing an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: The doctor preves illnesses by promoting healthy habits.
meanings.sent3: She preved a disaster by fixing the leaky faucet in time.
meanings.sent4: The security system preves unauthorized access to the building.
meanings.sent5: Wearing sunscreen helps preve sunburns during summer.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will preve the experiment before the students try it.
meanings.sent2: The chef preves the cooking technique to the audience before starting.
meanings.sent3: The magician preved the trick to the audience, but they still couldn't figure it out.
meanings.sent4: The artist preves the final painting by sketching the outline first.
meanings.sent5: The coach preves the winning strategy to the team before the match.
